intro: Elatostema falcifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, falcate (sickle-shaped) leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories or along stream banks. Elatostema falcifolium is an herbaceous plant with a short stem and is often used in traditional medicine in its native regions.
